Award.AwardTitle: Geometric Invariance and Partial Differential Equations
Award.AbstractNarration:
This award provides funding for US participation in the conference "Geometric Invariance and Partial Differential Equations" that will be held at the Academia Sinica Taipei January 17-20, 2018.

The conference focuses on recent developments in Analysis, especially in the fields of geometric partial differential equations and several complex variables. A number of distinguished mathematicians have agreed to attend and speak at this conference. This award gives early career researchers, members of underrepresented groups, researchers not funded by NSF and the like an opportunity to attend and participate in this conference. The organizing committee will strive to make this funding opportunity known to target groups through a number of different activities. More information will be made available at: http://www.math.sinica.edu.tw/www/file_upload/conference/201801-GEO/index.html

POR.DRECONTENT:
This grant is to support the travel of American mathematicians to attend the 2018 Taipei conference on geometric invariance and PDEs. The conference was held January 17-20 2018 in the Academia Sinica Mathematics Institute. The Academia Sinica is the conference organizer and had provided the venue and funding to cover the travel and local expenses for senior speakers at the conference. A number of graduate students and post-docs had attended this conference and the short courses. The short courses were given by Chin-Yu Hsiao of the academia Sinica on the Szego kernel in complex and CR geometry, and by Fernando Marques of   Princeton University on the Min-Max theory for the area functional. There were 20 lectures by speakers from Europe, Japan, China, the United States, and Taiwan. There were four short presentations by researchers from Taiwan. Some 60 people attended the conference, among them were 12 post-docs and granduate students from the US. supported by this grant. 

The conference provided the opportunity for interactions among the participants working in several related areas in geometric analysis such as minimal surface theory, conformal geometry, CR geometry and several complex variables and from a wide ranging geographic locations. There were new partnerships resulting from participation to this conference.
